tha-ap442:0.3_0: Declaring his fruit, the senior monks,
tha-ap442:1.2_0: the world, for the world of the gods,
tha-ap442:10.1_0: The fourth sub-chapter on dwellings is finished.
tha-ap442:12.1_0: A senior monk and a living alone
tha-ap442:12.4_0: with a thorn full of thorns.
tha-ap442:3.1_0: Though this sacrifice has been given up,
tha-ap442:3.2_0: the world doesn’t stay in the world.
tha-ap442:3.4_0: having left victory and defeat behind.
tha-ap442:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any bad places
tha-ap442:5.1_0: My defilements have been burnt away by practicing absorption—
tha-ap442:7.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
tha-ap442:8.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Makhādeva.
tha-ap442:9.1_0: He had ten fruits of mango groves.
